urls.description: 00002 Comparison of a model including the triangle singularities from Fig.~\ref{fig:loops}~(b) with the experimental data. Tree-level exchanges of the $N^*(1440)$, the $N^*(1520)$ and the $N^*(1650)$, as depicted in Fig.~\ref{fig:diagrams}, are included to describe the $p\pi$ invariant mass distribution. The data are taken from Ref.~\cite{Aaij:2014zoa}. The solid lines and binned histograms show the fit to the data in the range $M_{J/\psi p}\in [4.33,4.58]$~GeV and $M_{p\pi}\in [1.33,1.85]$~GeV, the dotted line shows the contribution from the tree-level exchange of the $N^*$ resonances and the dashed line show the contribution from triangle diagram.
00000 A triangle diagram. Here, each internal line is labelled by the mass of the corresponding particle and each external line by its four-momentum.
00004 Diagrams in the simple model used to fit to the LHCb data.
00005 Diagrams in the simple model used to fit to the LHCb data.

00003 Comparison of a model including the triangle singularities from Fig.~\ref{fig:loops}~(b) with the experimental data. Tree-level exchanges of the $N^*(1440)$, the $N^*(1520)$ and the $N^*(1650)$, as depicted in Fig.~\ref{fig:diagrams}, are included to describe the $p\pi$ invariant mass distribution. The data are taken from Ref.~\cite{Aaij:2014zoa}. The solid lines and binned histograms show the fit to the data in the range $M_{J/\psi p}\in [4.33,4.58]$~GeV and $M_{p\pi}\in [1.33,1.85]$~GeV, the dotted line shows the contribution from the tree-level exchange of the $N^*$ resonances and the dashed line show the contribution from triangle diagram.
00001 Triangle diagrams which can produce a peak around 4.45~GeV in the $J/\psi p$ invariant mass distribution for the processes (a) $\decaytoK$ and (b) $\decaytopi$.

00007 Comparing the locations of two triangle singularities close to the $\chi_{c1}p$ and $X(3872)p$ thresholds, respectively, with the LHCb data of the $J/\psi p$ invariant mass distribution for the decay $\decaytoK$.

00006 Comparison of the scalar three-point loop function for the $N^*(1900)$ with a complex mass $(1.9-i\,0.1)$~GeV (solid curve) with that convoluted with the spectral function as given in Eq.~\eqref{eq:spectral} (dashed curve).

titles.title: Remarks on the $P_c$ structures and triangle singularities

figures.caption: A triangle diagram. Here, each internal line is labelled by the mass of the corresponding particle and each external line by its four-momentum.
Triangle diagrams which can produce a peak around 4.45~GeV in the $J/\psi p$ invariant mass distribution for the processes (a) $\decaytoK$ and (b) $\decaytopi$.

Comparison of a model including the triangle singularities from Fig.~\ref{fig:loops}~(b) with the experimental data. Tree-level exchanges of the $N^*(1440)$, the $N^*(1520)$ and the $N^*(1650)$, as depicted in Fig.~\ref{fig:diagrams}, are included to describe the $p\pi$ invariant mass distribution. The data are taken from Ref.~\cite{Aaij:2014zoa}. The solid lines and binned histograms show the fit to the data in the range $M_{J/\psi p}\in [4.33,4.58]$~GeV and $M_{p\pi}\in [1.33,1.85]$~GeV, the dotted line shows the contribution from the tree-level exchange of the $N^*$ resonances and the dashed line show the contribution from triangle diagram.

Comparison of a model including the triangle singularities from Fig.~\ref{fig:loops}~(b) with the experimental data. Tree-level exchanges of the $N^*(1440)$, the $N^*(1520)$ and the $N^*(1650)$, as depicted in Fig.~\ref{fig:diagrams}, are included to describe the $p\pi$ invariant mass distribution. The data are taken from Ref.~\cite{Aaij:2014zoa}. The solid lines and binned histograms show the fit to the data in the range $M_{J/\psi p}\in [4.33,4.58]$~GeV and $M_{p\pi}\in [1.33,1.85]$~GeV, the dotted line shows the contribution from the tree-level exchange of the $N^*$ resonances and the dashed line show the contribution from triangle diagram.
Diagrams in the simple model used to fit to the LHCb data.
Diagrams in the simple model used to fit to the LHCb data.

Comparison of the scalar three-point loop function for the $N^*(1900)$ with a complex mass $(1.9-i\,0.1)$~GeV (solid curve) with that convoluted with the spectral function as given in Eq.~\eqref{eq:spectral} (dashed curve).

Comparing the locations of two triangle singularities close to the $\chi_{c1}p$ and $X(3872)p$ thresholds, respectively, with the LHCb data of the $J/\psi p$ invariant mass distribution for the decay $\decaytoK$.

abstracts.value: It was proposed that the narrow $P_{c}(4450)$ structure observed by the LHCb Collaboration in the reaction $\Lambda_{b}\rightarrow J/\psi p K$ might be due to a triangle singularity around the $\chi_{c1}$ -proton threshold at 4.45 GeV. We discuss the occurrence of a similar triangle singularity in the $J/\psi p$ invariant mass distribution for the decay $\Lambda_{b}\rightarrow J/\psi p \pi$ , which could explain the bump around 4.45 GeV in the data. More precise measurements of this process would provide valuable information towards an understanding of the $P_{c}$ structures.

It was proposed that the narrow $P_c(4450)$ structure observed by the LHCb Collaboration in the reaction $\Lambda_b\to J/\psi p K$ might be due to a triangle singularity around the $\chi_{c1}$--proton threshold at 4.45~GeV. We discuss the occurrence of a similar triangle singularity in the $J/\psi p$ invariant mass distribution for the decay $\Lambda_b\to J/\psi p \pi$, which could explain the bump around 4.45~GeV in the data. More precise measurements of this process would provide valuable information towards an understanding of the $P_c$ structures.

title.title: Three-particle physics and dispersion relation theory
